summary: Deutsche Welle (DW), funded by the German government, is a public international broadcaster offering services in 32 languages. Its satellite TV channels include German, English, Spanish, Hindi, Persian, and Arabic. Regulated by the Deutsche Welle Act, DW aims to provide independent content, reliable news, and promote understanding between cultures. Based in Bonn and Berlin, DW has been operating since 1953 and employs over 1,600 people, with a global workforce of over 4,000 from more than 140 countries.
title: Deutsche Welle
